verses.roman:
prāhiṇot pāribarhāṇi
vara-vadhvor mudā balaḥ
mahā-dhanopaskarebha-
rathāśva-nara-yoṣitaḥ

synonyms: prāhiṇot—He sent; pāribarhāṇi—as wedding gifts; vara-vadhvoḥ—for the groom and the bride; mudā—with pleasure; balaḥ—Lord Balarāma; mahā-dhana—greatly valuable; upaskara—presents; ibha—elephants; ratha—chariots; asva—horses; nara—men; yoṣitaḥ—and women.
translation: Lord Balarāma then happily sent the bride and groom very valuable wedding gifts consisting of elephants, chariots, horses and male and female servants.
